meanings.definition: To look about or stare with great curiosity, as by craning the neck or turning the head.
meanings.sent1: People were rubbernecking at the accident scene.
meanings.sent2: Tourists were rubbernecking at the tall buildings in the city.
meanings.sent3: The kids were rubbernecking at the strange animal in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't help rubbernecking at the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The crowd was rubbernecking at the celebrity walking by.

meanings.definition: The act of staring or gawking at something, especially out of curiosity.
meanings.sent1: There was a lot of rubbernecking at the unusual sculpture in the park.
meanings.sent2: Rubbernecking can cause traffic jams on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The rubbernecking at the new exhibit made the artist smile.
meanings.sent4: The rubbernecking in the museum was like a silent dance of curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The level of rubbernecking at the accident was astonishing.
